content.text:
# List of presidential trips made by Emmanuel Macron

This is a list of presidential trips made by Emmanuel Macron as the 25th President of France.
This list excludes trips made within Paris, the French capital in which the Élysée Palace, the official residence and principal workplace of the President, is located and Le Touquet, the location of Macron's house. International trips are included. The number of visits per country and department where he travelled are:
Domestic trips:
* One visit to Alpes-Maritimes, Corrèze, Ille-et-Vilaine, Finistère, Guadeloupe, Guyane, Haute-Garonne, Haute-Savoie, Haute-Vienne, Hautes-Alpes, Hautes-Pyrénées, Haut-Rhin, Loir-et-Cher, Loire-Atlantique, Loiret, Lyon Metropolis, Morbihan, Moselle, Pas-de-Calais, Puy-de-Dôme, Saint-Barthélémy, Saint-Martin, Savoie, Somme, Val-de-Marne and Var.
* Two visits to Bas-Rhin, Hauts-de-Seine, Nord and Seine-Maritime.
* Three visits to Bouches-du-Rhône.
* Six visits to Seine-Saint-Denis.
* Eight visits to Yvelines.
International trips:
* One visit to Algeria, Andorra, Austria, Australia, Bulgaria, Burkina Faso, China, Côte d'Ivoire, Estonia, Ghana, Greece, Luxembourg, Niger, Qatar, Romania, Saudi Arabia, South Korea, Sweden, United Arab Emirates, and the United Kingdom.
* Two visits to Morocco, Mali,  Switzerland, Tunisia and the United States.
* Three visits to Italy.
* Five visits to Germany.
* Six visits to Belgium.
2017
May
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!Department/Country
!Areas visited
!Date(s)
!Details
|-
|
|Berlin
|
|Emmanuel Macron's state visit to Germany was his first international trip as president. He chose Germany as the first foreign trip of his presidency in a demonstration of a pro-European sign, as well as to follow the tradition of French presidents making their first international trip to Germany. During his first full day in office, Macron met with German Chancellor Angela Merkel. The two leaders agreed to construct a plan to reform the European Union amidst the rise of right-wing populism and Euroscepticism.
|-
|
|Gao
|
|Macron met with French troops committed to Operation Barkhane. This was his first trip outside Europe as president.
|-
|
|Brussels
|
|Macron attended the NATO summit, his first summit meeting as president. He held separate bilateral meetings with other heads of government, including U.S. President Donald Trump.
|-
|
|Taormina
|
|Macron attended the 43rd G7 summit. He held separate bilateral meetings with other heads of government, including British Prime Minister Theresa May, Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau and Japanese Prime Minister Shinzō Abe.
|-
| Yvelines
|Versailles
|29 May
|Macron met Russian President Vladimir Putin in the Palace of Versailles.
|-
| Loire-Atlantique
|Saint-Nazaire
|31 May
|Macron visited the Chantiers de l'Atlantique in Saint-Nazaire.
|}
June
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!Department/Country
!Areas visited
!Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Morbihan
|Vannes, Étel, Lanester and Lorient
|1 June
|Macron visited the CROSS of the Bay of Biscay in Étel, a military base in Lanester and the port of Lorient. He met also a disabled child in Vannes.
|-
| Seine-Saint-Denis
|Saint-Denis
|4 June
|Macron attended in the Top 14, rugby union league final in the Stade de France.
|-
| Haute-Vienne
|Oradour-sur-Glane
|10 June
|Macron attended in the commemorations of the Oradour-sur-Glane massacre.
|-
| Seine-Saint-Denis
|Saint-Denis
|13 June
|Macron attended in a friendly football match between France and England with Theresa May in the Stade de France.
|-
| Morocco
|Rabat
|
|Macron met the king of Morocco, Mohammed VI of during this private and friendly trip.
|-
| Seine-Saint-Denis
|Le Bourget
|19 June
|Macron attended in the Paris Air Show.
|-
|
|Brussels
|
|Macron attended in his first European Council. He held separate bilateral meetings with Angela Merkel, and the representants of the Visegrád Group.
|-
|
|Berlin
|
|Emmanuel Macron met with other European heads of state and government, as part of the preparations for the 2017 G20 Hamburg summit.
|}
July
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!width=150|Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=60|Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Bas-Rhin
|Strasbourg
| rowspan="2" |1 July
|Macron participated in the tribute ceremony of Helmut Kohl inside the European Parliament in Strasbourg.
|-
| Ille-et-Vilaine
|Rennes
|Macron has inaugurated the new TGV Atlantique line in the Gare de Rennes.
|-
|
|Bamako
|
|Macron attends a security summit of the G5 Sahel to boost support for the creation of a regional counter-terror force.
|-
| Yvelines
|Versailles
|3 July
|Macron delivered a speech behind the Congress of the French Parliament in the Palace of Versailles.
|-
| Finistère
|Crozon
|4 July
|Emmanuel Macron went as head of the French Armed Forces to the Île Longue military base in the Roadstead of Brest and visited the submarine Le Terrible
|-
|
|Hamburg
|
|Macron attended in the 2017 G20 Hamburg summit. He held separate bilateral meetings with other heads of government, including Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau, Russian President Vladimir Putin, and with German Chancellor Angela Merkel.
|-
| Switzerland
|Lausanne
|10–11 July
|Macron travelled to Lausanne to visit the International Olympic Committee for the presentation of the Paris bid for the 2024 Summer Olympics. During this trip Macron was accompanied by his wife Brigitte, the Mayor of Paris Anne Hidalgo and the chairs of the bid, Bernard Lapasset and Tony Estanguet.
|-
|
|Trieste
|12–13 July
|Macron attended in the 2017 Western Balkans Summit. One day before, he meet German Chancellor Angela Merkel and Italian Prime Minister Paolo Gentiloni.
|-
| Alpes-Maritimes
|Nice
|14 July
|Macron attended the 2016 Nice truck attack commemorations with former French president Nicolas Sarkozy and François Hollande.
|-
| Savoie
Hautes-Alpes
|Saint-Michel-de-Maurienne, Serre Chevalier
|19 July
|Macron followed the Tour de France cyclists during the Stage 17. He embarked in the race director's car Christian Prudhomme in Col du Télégraphe entrance in Saint-Michel-de-Maurienne. He continued his journey by entering in the region Provence-Alpes-Côte d'Azur and finished the stage in the sky station of Serre Chevalier. Macron invited the Prime Minister of Denmark, Lars Løkke Rasmussen who is a cycling fan.
|-
| Bouches-du-Rhône
|Istres
|20 July
|Macron visited a military base in Istres, to reiterate its support for the Military, after the resignation of Pierre de Villiers, the former Chef d'état-major des Armées.
|-
| Yvelines
|La Celle-Saint-Cloud
|25 July
|Macron organized a peace a meeting, between Fayez al-Sarraj (Presidential Council), and Khalifa Haftar (Libyan National Army), in order to sign a cease fire.
|-
| Seine-Maritime
|Saint-Étienne-du-Rouvray
|26 July
|Macron attended in the 2016 Normandy church attack commemorations with Prime Minister Édouard Philippe.
|-
| Loiret
|Orléans
|27 July
|The French head of state was present in Orléans, Loiret to meet families of refugees and attend a naturalization ceremony. The Minister of the Interior, Gérard Collomb, was also present.
|}
August
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
! width="150" |Department/Country
!Areas visited
! width="60" |Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Yvelines
|Moisson
|3 August
|The president met, in a nautical base of the suburbs of Paris, young people deprived of holidays.
|-
| Bouches-du-Rhône
|Allauch, Marseille
|10–20 August
|Macron spent some holidays in the south of France.
|-
|
|Salzburg
|23 August
|Macron met with Austrian Chancellor Christian Kern.
|-
|
|Bucharest
|24 August
|Macron met with Romanian President Klaus Iohannis.
|-
|
|Varna
|25 August
|Macron met with Bulgarian President Rumen Radev and Prime Minister Boyko Borisov at the Euxinograd Palace.
|-
| Yvelines
|Hermeray
|27 August
|The president adopted a Labrador at the SPA refuge.
|-
| Luxembourg
|Luxembourg City, Niederanven
|28 August
|Macron met with Grand Duke Henri and Grand Duchess Maria Teresa of Luxembourg. He then traveled to Senningen Castle to participate in political talks with the Prime Minister of Luxembourg, Xavier Bettel, and Belgian Prime Minister Charles Michel.
|-
| Seine-Saint-Denis
|Saint-Denis
|31 August
|Macron attended a football match between France and the Netherlands for the 2018 FIFA World Cup qualification at Stade de France.
|}
September
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
! width="150" |Department/Country
! width="100" |Areas visited
! width="100" |Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Moselle
|Forbach
|4 September
|Macron visited a school for the start of the academic year.
|-
|
|Athens
|6–7 September
|Macron paid a state visit to Greece where he called to rebuild the European Union.
|-
| Haute-Savoie
|Évian-les-Bains
|7 September
|Macron attended the 26th French-German meeting.
|-
| Haute-Garonne
|Toulouse
|11 September
|Macron launched a plan for emergency housing for the most disadvantaged. Toulouse was chosen by the President to be a pilot city for this project.
|-
| Guadeloupe
|Pointe-à-Pitre
|rowspan="3"|12–13 September
|rowspan="3"|The President visited islands severely destroyed by Hurricane Irma
|-
| Saint-Martin
|Saint-Martin
|-
| Saint-Barthélemy
|Saint-Barthélemy
|-
| Yvelines
|Le Port-Marly
|16 September
|Macron visited with French TV-animator Stéphane Bern, the Château de Monte-Cristo in Le Port-Marly during the European Heritage Days.
|-
|
|New York City
|18–20 September
|Macron attended the 72nd United Nations General Assembly and met with several heads of state.
|-
| Bouches-du-Rhône
|Marseille
|21 September
|Macron visited the 2024 Summer Olympics venues for sailing and soccer.
|-
| Lyon Metropolis
|Lyon
|27–28 September
|Accompanied by the Minister of the Interior Gérard Collomb, Macron traveled to Lyon to meet law enforcement officials.
|-
|
|TallinnTapa Army Base
|28–29 September
|Macron attended the EU Digital Summit and held a bilateral meeting with German Chancellor Angela Merkel. He then visited troops together with British Prime Minister Theresa May and Estonian Prime Minister Jüri Ratas at Tapa Army Base.
|}
October
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
! width="150" |Department/Country
!Areas visited
! width="100" |Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Somme
|Amiens
|3 October
|Macron visited the sites of the companies Whirlpool and Amazon.
|-
| Corrèze
|Égletons
|4 October
|Macron launched the reform of the professional learnings.
|-
|
|Frankfurt
|10 October
|Macron and German Chancellor Angela Merkel attended the opening of the Frankfurt Book Fair.
|-
| Val-de-Marne
|Rungis
|11 October
|Macron visited the Rungis International Market.
|-
| Hauts-de-Seine
|Gennevilliers
|17 October
|Macron had lunch with actors of associative life.
|-
|
|Brussels
|19–20 October
|EU Summit
|-
| French Guiana
|Maripasoula, Cayenne
|26–28 October
|Macron visited French Guiana while protests occurred about the economic growth of this territory.
|-
| Bas-Rhin
|Strasbourg
|31 October
|Macron visited the Council of Europe and the European Court of Human Rights at the end of the state of emergency in France. Later on he went to the Opéra national du Rhin.
|}
November
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!width=170|Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=95|Date(s)
!Details
|-
| Seine-Maritime
|Le Havre
|4 November
|Macron visited Le Havre the day before the departure of the Transat Jacques Vabre.
|-
|
|Abu Dhabi, Dubai
|8–9 November
|Macron inaugurated the Louvre Abu Dhabi.
|-
|
|Riyadh
|9 November
|Macron made an emergency Saudi Arabia trip over Lebanon war fears.
|-
| Haut-Rhin
|Wattwiller
|10 November
|Macron inaugurated a historical museum at the Hartmannswillerkopf, together with the German President Frank-Walter Steinmeier.
|-
|rowspan="2"| Seine-Saint-Denis
|Saint-Denis
|rowspan="2"|13 November
|Macron attended the commemoration of the November 2015 Paris attacks.
|-
|Clichy-sous-Bois
|rowspan="2"|Macron made two visits related to the policies for the cities.
|-
| Nord
|Roubaix, Tourcoing
|13–14 November
|-
|
|Bonn
|15 November
|Macron attended the opening ceremony of the 2017 United Nations Climate Change Conference.
|-
|
|Gothenburg
|17 November
|Macron attended the Union European social summit.
|-
|
|Ouagadougou
| 28–29 November
|Macron met with the Burkinabe President, did a speech about Africa, exchanged with students and visited a solar-powered plant.
|-
|
|Abidjan
| 29–30 November
|Macron attended the Africa-European Union summit.
|-
|
|Accra
| 30 November
|Macron met with the Ghanaian president and visited some local start-ups.
|}
December
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!width=170|Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=95|Date(s)
!Details
|-
|
|Algiers
|6 December
|Macron made a work and friendship visit in Algeria.
|-
|
|Doha
|7 December
|Macron paid an official visit to Qatar.
|-
| Hauts-de-Seine
|Boulogne-Billancourt
|12 December
|Macron participated the One Planet Summit.
|-
| Yvelines
|La Celle-Saint-Cloud
|13 December
|Macron attended a security summit of the G5 Sahel.
|-
|
|Brussels
|
|Macron attended in a European Council.
|-
| Loir-et-Cher
|Saint-Aignan, Chambord
|
|Macron visited the ZooParc de Beauval and spent a night at Chambord for a family event.
|-
|
|Niamey
|
|Macron visited the French troops from Operation Barkhane.
|-
| Hautes-Pyrénées
|Bagnères-de-Bigorre
|
|Macron went skiing.
|}
2018
January
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=80|Date(s)
!Details
|-
|
| Xi'an, Beijing
|
|Macron arrived in Xi'an first, visited the Terracotta Army, Giant Wild Goose Pagoda and Xi'an great mosque. He also delivered a speech about multilateralism at Daming Palace National Heritage Park. Later he flew to Beijing, visited the Palace Museum and met with the Chinese President Xi Jinping and Premier Li Keqiang.
|-
|
| Rome
|
| Macron met southern European Union leaders about migration and budgets at Med7 summit.
|-
| Pas-de-Calais
|Croisilles, Calais
|
|Macron explained his policy on migration.
|-
|
| Camberley, London
|
|Macron met with Prime Minister Theresa May.
|-
| Var
|Toulon
|
|Macron greets the French army.
|-
| Nord
|Valenciennes
|
|Macron visited the Toyota plant to announce investments.
|-
| Yvelines
|Versailles
|
|Macron invited investors in Versailles to promote France.
|-
|
| Davos
|
|Macron made a speech in Davos.
|-
| Puy-de-Dôme
|Cébazat, Saint-Genès-Champanelle, Chamalières, Orcines, Picherande
|
|Macron visited Michelin plant and greeted farmers.
|}
February
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=80|Date(s)
!Details
|-
|
| Tunis
|
|Macron spoke in front of the Tunisian Parliament, attended an economic summit, and held talks with President Essebsi.
|-
|
| Dakar, Saint-Louis
|
|Macron met with President Macky Sall.
|-
| Corsica
|Bastia, San-Giuliano
|
|Macron met with representatives from Corsica.
|-
|
| Pyeongchang
|
|Macron attended the 2018 Winter Olympics opening ceremony.
|-
|
| Brussels
|
| Macron attended an extraordinary European Council on Brexit.
|}

{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"

!Areas visited

!Details

|Brussels
|

{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"

| Brussels

{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"

Future trips
{| class="wikitable sortable outercollapse" style="margin: 1em auto 1em auto"
!Department/Country
!Areas visited
!width=80|Date(s)
!Details
|-
|
| Riga
|
| State visit
|}
During the visit of the Prime Minister of Israel, Benjamin Netanyahu in Paris on July 16, 2017, Macron says that he will visit his counterpart in Israel.
